text: NARRATOR: What is an

Well, this is an Angie
Tribeca hyper binge--
every episode of Season 2.
That's right.
[screaming]

You can hyper binge every
episode of Season 2 right now.
Let's do this.
[sirens]

Previously on Season
1 of "Angie Tribeca"--
Geils, I'm coming.
But you already know about that.

(ANGRILY) Tribeca, what
the hell are you doing?

NARRATOR: Yeah, yeah,
you knew about that too.

Ooh, I wonder what
will happen on Episode

One of the second season
of "Angie Tribeca."

First, Angie got herself
exploded and woke
up from a coma a year later.

Then she found out about the
Geils' love triangle with her
and Scholls.

Did I mentioned
that she had Geils'
baby while she was in a coma?
You named her Angie after me?
I named him after you.

NARRATOR: Or the guest
star that contractually
we can't even tell you about.

Or the John Doe they found
murdered in the park.

Let's take a look at our John
Doe's name-- Jonathan Dough.

Or the fact that Tanner
brings Tribeca some comfort.

TANNER: You know what
always makes me feel better?
A big bag of dicks.

God, that's a lot of ground
to cover for one episode.
I'm starving.

NARRATOR: Oh, they found that
John Dough's murder by the way.

You're under arrest for the
murder of Jonathan Dough.

NARRATOR: And that's what
happened on "Angie Tribeca."

Then on Episode Two of the
second season of "Angie

Tribeca," Angie and
Geils found the dead body
of Sushi Chef Kobayashi Maru.
Call the coroner.
Tell her to bring the big mop.

NARRATOR: Then they
briefed Lieutenant Atkins.
Kobayashi Maru-- 71 years old.

Born in Osaka,
Japan, 71 years ago.
Mother, female-- father, male.
Current status dead.

NARRATOR: And where is he from?
-Japan.
NARRATOR: Got it.

Then they paid Dr.
Scholls a visit.

Which was awkward, because
she, Geils and Tribeca
are in a love triangle.

I'm in love with Tribeca,
but I'm dating you.

NARRATOR: But back
to the crime scene.

No prints, no hair, no
DNA from anyone else.

What about the giant
harpoon under the sheet?

I shot this very harpoon
at a whaling boat.
How does that exonerate you?

(MOCKING) How does
that exonerate you?

NARRATOR: Sick
burn, Busy Philipps.

And then they went to
the Japanese restaurant
Kobayashi owned.

GEILS: Joseph Takagi,
you're under arrest

for the murder and immaculate
plating of Kobayashi Maru.
Appetizers on the house?

NARRATOR: You damn right
they're on the house.

And that's what happened
on "Angie Tribeca."

And then on Episode Three
of the second season

of "Angie Tribeca,"
Geils was feeling
the burden of parenthood.

-Geils, get down.
-I can't.

If I stop bouncing,
he'll start crying.

NARRATOR: Then a dead body
washed up on the beach,
typical.

Before we go any
further, I think it just

needs to be said that this guy
is ripped-- abs, pecks, Magic

Mike V. I'm not saying
I'm gay or a necrophiliac,

but if I was, I certainly
wouldn't tell you guys.

NARRATOR: Then they had a
fight about their freaky love
triangle.

He's having sex with me
when he thinks about you.
Get over it.

NARRATOR: So Geils went
undercover as a lifeguard

to find out who was
dumping all those bodies.

It's kind of fun to
say-- dumping bodies,
dumping bodies, dumping bodies.

We got a mantra out
here, no fatties.

NARRATOR: But the
lifeguards were on to him.

Then it turned out
that all the lifeguards
were undercover cops.
Alberto Martinez, ATF.
Stacy Galina, FBI.

Mama Lukabubude, ADT
Security Services.
NARRATOR: Mama Lukabubude?
Hey, that's kind of fun to say.

Mama Lukabubude,
dumping bodies, Mama
Lukabubude, dumping bodies.

And that's what happened
on "Angie Tribeca."

After that, on Episode
Four of the second season
of "Angie Tribeca"--

ATKINS: Has anyone here heard
of the website MeetandCheat.org?
[coughing]
Their server's been hacked.

NARRATOR: Excuse me, I had
something in my throat.

The FBI has sent
us a tech expert
to help out with the case.

NARRATOR: I bet
it's Heather Graham.
Special Agent Diane Duran.
Good morning.
NARRATOR: I won that bet.

Agent Duran, Detectives
Treils and Gibeca.
He's Treils, I'm Gibeca.

NARRATOR: No you're
not, and Heather
Graham isn't who she seems.

When you see the
bigger picture, Tribeca,

it will all make
sense, and you're

going to be a big part of it.
-Really?

I'm going to be
a big part of it?

Wait, I don't want
any part of it.
But like how big of a part?

NARRATOR: You're
the title character.

(YELLING) Tribeca?
NARRATOR: Hold tight, Geils.
GEILS: (YELLING) Tribec-- aagh!
NARRATOR: Yikes.

You can't compete
with me, Tribeca.
NARRATOR: Call for backup.
I need back up.
She's too much woman for me.

Show her the woman
cop you really are.

NARRATOR: That's
it, keep going--

[ripping]
slower.
Wow, that look is perfect.

NARRATOR: Keep it in your
pants, because that's what
happened on "Angie Tribeca."
I'm so confused.

NARRATOR: Then on Episode
Five of the second season
of "Angie Tribeca"--

Someone is pushing Mayor
Perry's donors down the stairs,

but because they're old
no one looks into it.
But guess what?

I looked into it,
and it turns out

someone is pushing Mayor
Perry's donors down the stairs,

but because they're old
no one looks into it.

But guess what?
I looked into it.

I'm going to stop
you right there.

NARRATOR: Geils stops
Angie right there.
and so does the police chief--

ATKINS: I am going to say this
once-- stand down, stand down.

NARRATOR: --who hires this
lady to keep stopping Tribeca.
Are you working a case?
Nope, just getting a mop.
WOMAN: Uh, uh, uh--

NARRATOR: How'd
she get in there?
WOMAN: Nice try.
NARRATOR: What the [beep]?

But nothing can stop Angie
from talking about old people.

Geils, please, old
people are dying.
Would you listen to yourself?

TRIBECA (ON RECORDER): Geils,
please, old people are dying.
Is that what I sound like?

NARRATOR: Then
Geils gets an offer
that stops him in his tracks.

I got to tell you the coffee
upstairs is really excellent.

NARRATOR: Cream
and sugar, please.

Why is it so important
that I go upstairs?

Because he wants to
push you down them.

One cup of Jo,
that's all I'm saying.

The only Joe you'll be
cupping is the prison warden.

NARRATOR: You just got
served, and that's what
happened on "Angie Tribeca."

Later, on Episode Six
of the second season
of "Angie Tribeca"--
[screaming]

It is my dream to
one day cure cancer,

so that once again we may
all enjoy the pleasures
of smoking and drinking.

NARRATOR: That
science sounds right.
Then this happened.

I need you two to get
over to the hospital.
Somebody's stealing organs.

Do we know who?
It would save a lot of time.

NARRATOR: It would, Geils, but
then the show would be over.
Back to the hospital.
Have you seen this kidney?
SURGEON:Ugh, gross.
Why would you show me that?
NARRATOR: Super gross.
Nurse Lowboobs--
Oh, how you doing, sister?
Come on, baby.

NARRATOR: Then they took this
nurse in for questioning.

After the doctor left,
I made an incision
and took the kidney out.
You're a lying whore.
Who is she?

NARRATOR: Maya Rudolph,
she's very famous.

Now, blow your nose
on this kitten.
What happened?

NARRATOR: Angie's kidney was
stolen and put in a cooler,

but Geils performed
emergency surgery.

It's the oldest
story in the world.
NARRATOR: It really is.

Thanks for putting
my kidney back.

I'll think about you
every time I pee.

NARRATOR: And that's
what happened--

[screaming]
--on "Angie Tribeca."

After that, on Episode
Seven of the second season

of "Angie Tribeca," Angie
took a personal day.

Because this time,
it's personal.
TANNER: We get a personal days?
I came in when I had meningitis.

NARRATOR: Than a boy band member
named PT Cruiser accidentally
got his head blown off.

-So where's the head?
-On eBay.

NARRATOR: Then Geils questioned
the rest of the boy band.
GEILS: Skyler, the pretty one.
Chad, the fat one.
Funny, funny one.

NARRATOR: Then Tribeca visited
Heather Graham in prison.

Would you care for
a glass of pinot?

It's from the
vineyard in my toilet.

NARRATOR: Heather Graham
in prison, all pent up
and behind bars.

Than Tanner went undercover
and joined the boy band.
I can do it.
You sure, Tanner?

I mean I did the [inaudible]
for six months down

at the Pantages, which you all
would have known about if you'd
came to one of my shows.

Oh, that was a
crazy time for me.

NARRATOR: Then,
James Franco said--

I'm going to go pee
so I don't get a UTI.

NARRATOR: Then they figured out
it was Skyler, the pretty one.

GEILS: Tanner, turns out
Skyler is the murderer.
Oh, found out already, good.

And that's what happened
on "Angie Tribeca."

Here's what happened
on Episode Eight

of the second season
of "Angie Tribeca."
[whistle blowing]
Is that a whistle?

In his windpipe, and
something tells me
he wasn't born with it.
Although, he did die with it.

NARRATOR: After seven episodes,
Geils finally makes his move.

I'm so incredibly
attracted to you.
[burping]
NARRATOR: Good gravy.
I'm in a bad place, Geils.
You don't want any part of this.
NARRATOR: I know I don't.

Meanwhile, Atkins and
Tanner were on the job.
Tanner, hit the siren.
[making siren noises]

NARRATOR: The napkins
called in a favor.
President Obama?

Is it OK if we look inside
a Coast Guard truck?

Thank you.
Good night, sir.
Wait, can I talk to him?
Oh, he hung up.

NARRATOR: Then
Geils got a tattoo.
Smash Mouth is two words.

NARRATOR: Back to
Atkins and Tanner
who busted a truck full of--
How's it going, eh?
TANNER: Canadians.
Mr. President?
We have a situation.
NARRATOR: How a-boot that?
[screaming]

NARRATOR: And that's what
happened on "Angie Tribeca."
Disgusting, isn't it?
Horrible.

NARRATOR: And then, on Episode
Nine of the second season
of "Angie Tribeca"--

A graphic designer
has been murdered.
[thud]
NARRATOR: Ouch.

Click, click, mouse,
mouse, mouse, print, print--

NARRATOR: So Geils
questioned this guy.

Mr. Cook, where
were you last night?

-I was in Oklahoma.
-Which part?
Understudy for Curly McClain.

I'm going to need
to see a playbill.

NARRATOR: The Oxnard
Herold gave it three stars,
but then this happened.

Found this in the dumpster
next to Ellsworth's apartment.

There's traces of blood in
here that matched the victim--

That would tell us
exactly who did it.
A. Tribeca.

Please tell me it's
not Angie Tribeca.
I'm afraid so.

The Angie Tribeca
that works here?
Yep.

NARRATOR: Ooh, damn,
it's going down.
And this time it's personal.

NARRATOR: This
time it's personal.
This time is personal.

NARRATOR: This
time it's personal.
This time is personal.

NARRATOR: This time
it's personable.

Well, I guess, you have no
choice but to arrest me, Jay.

ATKINS: I just want you to know
if there's anything you need--
I know.

But we can't really
help you right now.
You're pretty toxic.

TRIBECA: Ow.
NARRATOR: Yikes.

TRIBECA: Ow.
-All right.
ATKINS: Oh.

NARRATOR: And that's what
happened on "Angie Tribeca."

(WHISPERING) Do it.
[door slamming]

NARRATOR: And finally,
on the last episode

of the second season
of "Angie Tribeca."

Hoffman took a shower, which is
hilarious because he's a dog.
Get out of the shower, dog.
The mayor's wife is in danger.

I'm having Tanner and
Hoffman transport he

and his wife to a safe house
at an undisclosed location.

NARRATOR: Then Tanner and
Hoffman actually transported

the mayor and his
wife to a safe house
at an undisclosed location.

Then Tribeca and Geils
lit the ignition button
and primed the love pump.
You seem different.
All women should go to prison.

NARRATOR: After that
was over, they figured
out how to catch James Franco.

TRIBECA: We put him the
mayor where Pepper wants him,

and then when the mouse
goes in for the cheese--
GEILS: He eats the cheese--
TRIBECA: --we spring the trap.

Wait, if you're
Tribeca, then who's this?

After a series of
elaborate disguises--
You had sex with me.

NARRATOR: They finally figured
out who slept with whom.

Wait, so then who
ended up having sex?

NARRATOR: And that's what
happened on "Angie Tribeca."
Smell you later.

"Angie Tribeca" Season 2, all
new Mondays at 9:00 on TBS.
